string_parameter.hints: {'widget': 'popup', 'options': 'Scale Rotate Translate|Scale Translate Rotate|Rotate Scale Translate|Rotate Translate Scale|Translate Scale Rotate|Translate Rotate Scale'}
string_parameter.name: transformOrder
lua
string_parameter.value:
-- Removes all locations not contributing to the light path local lightPath = Interface.GetOpArg('user.lightPath'):getValue() local outputLocationPath = Interface.GetOutputLocationPath() local children = Interface.GetPotentialChildren():getNearestSample(0)
for _, childName in pairs(children) do local childLocationPath = outputLocationPath .. "/" .. childName if not PathUtils.IsAncestorOrEqual(childLocationPath, lightPath) then Interface.DeleteChild(childName) end end
function findCommonAncestor(path1, path2) local path1Components = pystring.split(path1, '/') local path2Components = pystring.split(path2, '/')
local maxLengthToSearch = math.min(#path1Components, #path2Components)
local result = '' local i = 1 while path1Components[i] == path2Components[i] and i < maxLengthToSearch do if path1Components[i]:len() > 0 then result = result .. '/' .. path1Components[i] end
i = i + 1 end return result end
-- Make 'inherits' location relative to our location local inheritsAttribute = Interface.GetAttr('inherits') if inheritsAttribute then -- First find the common ancestor between the two locations. local inheritsLocationPath = inheritsAttribute:getValue() local commonAncestor = findCommonAncestor(outputLocationPath, inheritsLocationPath)
-- Determine the number of '../' we need to append to the common ancestor -- to get from the current location to the common ancestor. local outputLocationPathStem = outputLocationPath:sub(commonAncestor:len() + 2) local numLevelsFromAncestor = pystring.count(outputLocationPathStem, '/')
-- Then determine the stem that we will append. local inheritsLocationPathStem = inheritsLocationPath:sub(commonAncestor:len() + 2)
-- Set the relative location path local relativeLocationPath = '' if numLevelsFromAncestor == 0 then relativeLocationPath = '../' .. inheritsLocationPathStem else relativeLocationPath = pystring.mul("../", (numLevelsFromAncestor + 1)) .. inheritsLocationPathStem end Interface.SetAttr("inherits", StringAttribute(relativeLocationPath))
-- Set a local version of the "inherits" location path by stripping -- the Gaffer node's root location path from it local gafferRootPath = Interface.GetOpArg('user.gafferRootPath'):getValue() local localInheritsPath = inheritsLocationPath:sub(gafferRootPath:len() + 2) Interface.SetAttr("info.localInherits", StringAttribute(localInheritsPath)) end

string_parameter.name: lua
string_parameter.value:
-- Determines whether or not the given child of the given location -- should be deleted. This is done by checking for the existence of -- a __gafferPackage attribute (either on the child, or on any of its -- descendants) - if the attribute exists, then the child should not be -- deleted, if it doesn't exist (and doesn't exist on any of its -- descendants) then it should be deleted. This attribute is added to -- all locally created packages, as well as all adopted packages, so -- the end result is that all packages that are neither locally created -- nor adopted will be marked for deletion. function shouldDelete(currentLocation, childName) local childLocation = currentLocation .. "/" .. childName
-- Check for the existence of the __gafferPackage attribute on this -- child location. local packageAttr = Interface.GetAttr("__gafferPackage", childLocation) if nil ~= packageAttr then -- The attribute exists, so don't delete this child location. return false end
-- Otherwise, recurse over the children local potentialChildren = Interface.GetPotentialChildren(childLocation):getNearestSample(0.0) for i=1, #potentialChildren do if not shouldDelete(childLocation, potentialChildren[i]) then -- One or more of the children of this location should not -- be deleted, so don't delete this location either. return false end end
-- Default to deleting the location. return true end
-- Loop over all potential children at the current cook location and -- use shouldDelete() to determine whether or not to delete them. local potentialChildren = Interface.GetPotentialChildren():getNearestSample(0.0) for i=1, #potentialChildren do local childName = potentialChildren[i] if shouldDelete(Interface.GetOutputLocationPath(), childName) then Interface.DeleteChild(childName) end end

string_parameter.name: lua
string_parameter.value:
-- Sets an "info.gaffer.notInInput" attribute on the cooked location -- if it represents a Gaffer edit package without a corresponding -- Gaffer creation package in the incoming scene.
local packageAttr = Interface.GetAttr("__gafferPackage") local packageClass = Interface.GetAttr("info.gaffer.packageClass")
if nil == packageClass and nil ~= packageAttr then Interface.SetAttr("type", StringAttribute("warning")) Interface.SetAttr("warningMessage", StringAttribute( "Package adopted but not present in input scene.")) Interface.SetAttr("info.gaffer.notInInput", IntAttribute(1)) end

string_parameter.name: lua
string_parameter.value:
-- Deletes the cooked location if it represents a Gaffer edit -- package without a corresponding Gaffer creation package in the -- incoming scene.
local packageAttr = Interface.GetAttr("__gafferPackage") local packageClass = Interface.GetAttr("info.gaffer.packageClass")
if nil == packageClass and nil ~= packageAttr then Interface.DeleteSelf() end
